name: 55 Cnc
scenarioDescription:
The 55 Cnc Exoplanetary System


Overview

55 Cnc is a star with 0.91 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.94 times its radius. It is located 41.0630404 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10.2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

55 Cnc is known to have 5 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 55 Cnc system

55 Cnc b

55 Cnc b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the Radial Velocity method. The mass of 55 Cnc b is 263.9785 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, 55 Cnc b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, 55 Cnc b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


55 Cnc c

55 Cnc c was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the Radial Velocity method. The mass of 55 Cnc c is 54.4738 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, 55 Cnc c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, 55 Cnc c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


55 Cnc d

55 Cnc d was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the Radial Velocity method. The mass of 55 Cnc d is 1232.493 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, 55 Cnc d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, 55 Cnc d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


55 Cnc e

55 Cnc e was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the Radial Velocity method. The mass of 55 Cnc e is 8.08 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 55 Cnc e is 1.91 that of Earth. At 8.08 Earth masses, 55 Cnc e is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


55 Cnc f

55 Cnc f was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the Radial Velocity method. The mass of 55 Cnc f is 44.812 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, 55 Cnc f is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 55 Cnc, which contains 5 planets and was discovered by Lick Observatory.
